ygData.subject: Should I say that the end is near?...
ygData.msgSnippet: Tarantopulous flings a knife at Deemos. Deemos catches it out of the air. Tarantopulous: ..... Deemos: You underestimate your father. Deemos flings the knife.

Subject: Should I say that the end is near?...

------=_NextPart_000_02C5_01C0BEFD.4CB668C0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Tarantopulous flings a knife at Deemos. Deemos catches it out of the air.

=
Tarantopulous: .....

Deemos: You underestimate your father.

Deemos flings=
 the knife. Tarantopulous ducks, then stands up. The knife bounces off a ro=
ck and falls to the floor. Deemos thought it would bounce back at Tarantopu=
lous, as Deemos had the power and timing to do that with knives, but he goo=
fed. Tarantopulous draws a blaster, but looks to the ground while doing so,=
 and when he looks back towards Deemos, Deemos is standing right in his fac=
e. Deemos grabs the blaster and squeezes the barrels shut as Tarantopulous =
fires. The blaster exploded, blasting Tarantopulous backwards. Deemos still=
 stood.

Deemos: I am a good actor. You thought I was weak, Taran.

Taranto=
pulous: You will still die.

Deemos: I doubt it.

Tarantopulous picked up t=
he knife he threw earlier and flung it. It found it's mark in Deemos' chest=
. Deemos plucks it out and acts like nothing happened.

Deemos: Taran, you =
are pathetic! Didn't you learn how to fight?

Taran: But....

Deemos: That =
guy? The absorbing guy? He was nothing. I am god, Taran.

Tarantopulous run=
s at Deemos and knocks him backwards and onto a area with leaves. Deemos gr=
abs the side before he falls through, as it was one of his traps. Tarantopu=
lous falls into the hole. Deemos pulls himself up onto the ledge.

Deemos: =
Intelligence, Taran. You don't have it.

Tarantopulous: You're still dead.
=

Deemos: I'd have already been out of the pit.

Deemos presses a button on =
his familiar looking remote control. Spikes extended slowly from all sides =
of the pit, the top caged up.

Tarantopulous: I can break this cage within =
a few seconds.

Tarantopulous grabbed hold of the cage bar. Deemos stepped =
on his fingers and dropped him back in.

Deemos: Only a fitting end for som=
eone like you. Family is good, but you and Inzola were not my family. My so=
n is far greater than you, Taran. He's waiting for me back at the Alliance =
base, his name is Sharpedge.

Deemos pressed a few buttons, and spikes came=
 from the cage at the top of the pit. Gnarled spikes waiting to rip someone=
 open.

Deemos: I wasted this trap on you, really, but I had to use it on s=
omebody.

Tarantopulous: Someday, I will kill you, demon.

Deemos: I doubt =
it.

Deemos walked away. He expected a scream, but all he heard was a huge =
crunch and goring sound. Gore and internal's splattered as far as several f=
eet in front of him, covering him in mech fluid. He looked back to the pit =
to find mech fluid splattered everywhere. He walked towards the pit. There =
were no pieces of Tarantopulous that weren't splattered or disassembled.

D=
eemos: Welcome to the pit, Taran.

Deemos walked back towards the Iron Fist=
, picking up Inzola's hand and kissing it, then throwing it into the mech f=
luid that burbled up from the pit and ran 40 feet away from the splatter. D=
eemos kicked a gear into a bush and continued his walk towards the Iron Fis=
t...
